ab.title: Numbers 18
ab.l:
And
the Lord said to Aaron, ‘You and your sons and your father’s house
with you shall bear the punishment of the iniquity of the sanctuary,
and you and your sons with you shall bear the punishment
of the iniquity of your priesthood.

And bring forward your brothers,
the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, with you as well,
and they shall be joined to you and minister to you, and you
and your sons with you |shall minister| before the tent of law.

And they shall keep your charge and the charge of all
the tent, but they shall not come near the vessels of the Holy and the altar,
so they will not die, both they and you.

And they shall be joined to you and keep the charge of the tent
of meeting, for all the service of the tent, and an outsider shall not come near
to you.

And you shall keep the charge of the Holy
and the charge of the altar, so there will not be anger any more
on the children of Israel.

And I, lo, I have taken
your brothers, the Levites, from among the children
of Israel, to give them as a gift to you for the Lord, to do the service
in the tent of meeting.

And
you and your sons with you shall keep your priesthood
for everything at the altar, and within the veil, and you shall
serve: I have given your priesthood to you as a gift for service. And the
outsider that comes near shall be put to death.’

And
the Lord spoke to Aaron, ‘And I, lo, have given you the charge
of my heave offerings of all the holies of the children of Israel.
I have given them to you as an anointing, and to your sons, as an eternal
statute.

This shall be yours of the holy of holies,
from the fire: every offering of theirs, every grain offering of theirs, and every
sin offering of theirs, and every guilt offering of theirs, which they shall pay back to me.
It is holy of holies for you and for your sons.

In the holy of holies you shall eat it. Every male shall eat it.
It shall be holy to you.

And this is yours: the heave offering
of their gifts, with all the wave offerings of the children of Israel.
I have given them to you and to your sons and to your daughters with you,
as an eternal statute. Everyone who is clean in your house shall eat it.

All the oil of the olive oil, and all the oil of the must and of the grain,
the firstfruits of them which they shall give to the Lord, I have given
them to you.

And the firstfruits of all that is in their land
which they will bring to the Lord, shall be yours. Everyone who is clean
in your house shall eat it.

Everything devoted in Israel
shall be yours.

Every opening of the womb of all flesh
which they bring forward to the Lord, both among men and animals, shall be yours.
Just: you shall surely redeem the firstborn of man, and
you shall redeem the firstborn of unclean animals.

And those that are to be redeemed from a month old you shall redeem
according to your valuation, five mithqals of silver according to the mithqal of the Holy:
it is twenty gögs.

Just: you shall not redeem the firstborn
of a cattle or the firstborn of a sheep or the
firstborn of a goat. They are holy.
You shall sprinkle their blood on the altar, and
you shall burn their fat for an offering by fire, an aroma of acceptance to the Lord.

And their meat shall be yours, like the breast
of the wave offering and like the right thigh it shall be yours.

All the heave offerings of the holy things which
the children of Israel devote to the Lord I have given to you and to your sons
and to your daughters with you, an eternal statute:
it is a covenant made forever before the Lord to you and
to your offspring with you.’

And the Lord said to Aaron,
‘You shall take no portion in their land, and there shall be no share
for you among them. I am your portion and your share
among the children of Israel.

And to the children of Levi,
lo, I have given every tenth in Israel for a portion, a reward for their service
which they serve, the service of the tent of meeting.

And the children of Israel shall not come near
the tent of meeting anymore, so as to bear the punishment of sin and die.

But the Levites shall do the service
of the tent of meeting, and they shall bear the punishment of their iniquity,
it is an eternal statute throughout your generations. And they shall not take a part among the children
of Israel:

Because I have given to the Levites the tithes of the children of Israel which they dedicated as a heave offering to the Lord as a portion. On account of this I have said to them: they shall take no portion among the children of Israel.’

And
the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘And speak
to the Levites and say to them, “When you take from the children
of Israel the tithes which I have given you from them
for your portion, then you shall dedicate of it a heave offering of the Lord,
a tithe of the tithe.

And your heave offering shall be reckoned to you,
like grain from the threshing-floor and like wine from the
wine press.

Thus you also shall dedicate, you too, a heave offering
of the Lord of all your tithes which you take from the children of Israel.
And you shall give the Lord’s heave offering from it to Aaron,
the priest.

From all your gifts you shall separate
every heave offering of the Lord, from all of the oil of its holier part.”

And you shall say to them, “When you have separated its oil
from it, then it shall be reckoned to the Levites like the crop
of the threshing-floor and like the crop of the wine press.

And you shall eat
it in every place, you and your households, for it is a reward
for you, a reward for your service in the tent of meeting.

And
you shall bear no punishment for a sin when you have separated
from it the oil of it. And you shall not defile the holy things of the children
of Israel, and you will not die.”’
